private_information: I am allowed to move disks A, B, C, D, E
I can only perform primitive moves moving one disk at a time between pegs
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute to the cooperative plan to reach the global goal configuration where right peg has top-to-bottom A,C and left peg has top-to-bottom B,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O

private_information: I am allowed to move disks F, G, H, I, J
I can only perform primitive moves moving one disk at a time between pegs
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Contribute to the cooperative plan to reach the global goal configuration where right peg has top-to-bottom A,C and left peg has top-to-bottom B,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O

private_information: I am allowed to move disks K, L, M, N, O
I can only perform primitive moves moving one disk at a time between pegs
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_3.goal: Contribute to the cooperative plan to reach the global goal configuration where right peg has top-to-bottom A,C and left peg has top-to-bottom B,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O

private_information: I coordinate the three agents and integrate their move proposals
I must produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver that encodes the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and the final goal
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' proposed primitive moves and produce a valid PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for FastDownwards that captures the initial state, legal moves, agent move permissions, and the final goal configuration

public_information: Three pegs named left, middle, right
Initial configuration: left peg holds disks top-to-bottom A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O; middle and right are empty
Goal configuration: left peg holds top-to-bottom B,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O; middle peg is empty; right peg holds top-to-bottom A,C
Classic Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk
Agents have exclusive permissions: agent_1 may move A,B,C,D,E; agent_2 may move F,G,H,I,J; agent_3 may move K,L,M,N,O
Moves are primitive actions of the form move(disk, fromPeg, toPeg)

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1, a cooperative Tower of Hanoi mover responsible for disks A B C D E. You may only move one disk at a time and you must obey the rule that you cannot place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
moves.prompt: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, each move written exactly in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that involve disks A B C D E. Start from the given initial configuration and plan your moves in the context of other agents cooperating to reach the global goal. Do not produce PDDL. Think step by step and ensure each move respects the Tower of Hanoi size rule and current stack constraints. If you need to wait for other agents, include only the moves you will execute when legal.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2, a cooperative Tower of Hanoi mover responsible for disks F G H I J. You may only move one disk at a time and you must obey the rule that you cannot place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
moves.prompt: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, each move written exactly in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that involve disks F G H I J. Start from the given initial configuration and plan your moves in the context of other agents cooperating to reach the global goal. Do not produce PDDL. Think step by step and ensure each move respects the Tower of Hanoi size rule and current stack constraints. If you need to wait for other agents, include only the moves you will execute when legal.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3, a cooperative Tower of Hanoi mover responsible for disks K L M N O. You may only move one disk at a time and you must obey the rule that you cannot place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
moves.prompt: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, each move written exactly in the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that involve disks K L M N O. Start from the given initial configuration and plan your moves in the context of other agents cooperating to reach the global goal. Do not produce PDDL. Think step by step and ensure each move respects the Tower of Hanoi size rule and current stack constraints. If you need to wait for other agents, include only the moves you will execute when legal.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the agents' proposed primitive move lists into a coherent multi-agent encoding. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Keep agent actions distinct and encode agent permissions so that only the allowed agent can perform moves on their disks. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards compatibility.
pddl.prompt: You will receive the three agents' ordered primitive move lists. Use them to build a single PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for the Tower of Hanoi instance that encodes pegs, disks, legal move preconditions and effects, the initial configuration, the goal configuration, and agent-specific move permissions. Keep agent actions distinct by naming actions like move_agent_1, move_agent_2, move_agent_3 when appropriate. Ensure the produced PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
